problem_text:
If G is a finite-dimensional vector space over a field and Γ is a group of automorphisms of G in which every element is stable, then the whole of Γ is stable (E. Kolchin). Is Kolchin’s theorem true for spaces over skew fields?
B. I. Plotkin
answer: Yes, it is, if the characteristic of the skew field is zero or sufficiently large compared to the dimension of the space (H. Y. Mochizuki, Canad. Math. Bull., 21 (1978), 249–250).
